name: dimensionally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to the dimensions (= measurements such as height, length, or width) of something: The material is lightweight, non-absorbent, fire resistant, and dimensionally stable. The two designs have elements that are dimensionally identical. See also
-dimensionally
formal in a way that measures something on a scale (= a set of numbers to measure or compare the level of something): Trained interviewers rated the disorder dimensionally on a 5-point scale. Each anxiety symptom was assessed dimensionally rather than as the presence or absence of a disorder.
More examplesFewer examplesThe crystals were dimensionally characterized along the three axes.The use of moulds is commonly associated with a dimensionally homogeneous product. There are a variety of scales to dimensionally measure severity of symptoms, disability, and quality of life.

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
Conditions and characteristics
in a way that has or appears to have the stated number of dimensions (= measurements such as height, length, or width): The backgrounds are rendered in beautiful lifelike graphics rather than being drawn two-dimensionally. This is a type of navigation that allows an aircraft to fly a specific path between two 3-dimensionally defined points in space.
More examplesFewer examplesCancer cells grown in a petri dish in the lab are not like cancer cells in the body, because they tend to grow two-dimensionally.He had the idea of draping fabric in a way that fits onto the body almost three-dimensionally.The treatment addresses scoliosis 3-dimensionally, to correct the spine in every direction.I prefer creating sculptural works because it is actually easier for me to think three-dimensionally.
